station.name: Groove Salad
station.description: A nicely chilled plate of ambient beats and grooves
station.longdesc: Downtempo electronica featuring artists such as Kruder & Dorfmeister, Fila Brazila, Dhzian and Kamien, Afterlife, Zero Seven, Nightmares On Wax, Shantel, Groove Armada and artists on Pork Recordings, Waveform Records and Cafe del Mar recordings.

station.name: Dub Step Beyond
station.description: Dubstep, Dub and Deep Bass. May damage speakers at high volume.
station.longdesc: The place for Bass Music! Dubstep, Dub and Deep Bass. May damage speakers at high volume.

station.name: Drone Zone
station.description: Served best chilled, safe with most medications. Atmospheric textures with minimal beats
station.longdesc: Droning atmospheric space music and ambient textures with minimal beats. Music on Drone Zone is all about sonic textures and environments. Youll hear music by artists such as Pete Namlook, Steve Roach, Harold Budd, Brian Eno, Stars of the Lid, Dilate and the KLF.

station.name: indie pop rocks
station.description: New and favorite classic indie pop tracks
station.longdesc: Indie Pop Rocks! features the latest unsigned bands to the hottest new independent artists from around the globe, with a liberal sprinkling of classic and favorite indie tunes mixed in. From The Pixies and Built to Spill to the Arcade Fire and The Decemberists, these tracks are all winners.

station.name: Lush
station.description: Sensuous and mellow vocals, mostly female, with an electronic influence
station.longdesc: Soft and mellow female vocals (for the most part) with a slight electronica influence.

station.name: Secret Agent
station.description: The soundtrack for your stylish, mysterious, dangerous life. For Spies and PIs too!
station.longdesc: An eclectic blend of cinematic downtempo, stylish lounge, sambas and easy-tempo sixties European pop music with an adventurous flair. Artists you'll hear include Piero Piccioni, De-Phazz, Seks Bomba, Shirley Bassey, Henry Mancini, William Orbit, Yoshinori Sunahara, Martin Denny and Walter Wanderly.

station.name: Space Station Soma
station.description: Tune in, turn on, space out. Spaced-out ambient and mid-tempo electronica
station.longdesc: Mostly analog electronic music, broadcast from deep space to us here on earth.

station.name: Beat Blender
station.description: A late night blend of deep-house and downtempo chill
station.longdesc: Beat Blender is a perfect blend of midtempo and more upbeat electronica, featuring artists such as Bullitnuts, The Verbrilli Sound, Baby Mammoth, Thievery Corp, Boards of Canada, Royksopps, and Ltj Bukem. Beat Blender will keep you awake but not stress you out.

station.name: Suburbs of Goa
station.description: Desi-influenced Asian world beats and beyond
station.longdesc: Desi sounds and beyond. Music on Suburbs of Goa is the future of the Eastern world. You'll hear artists like: Karsh Kale, Cheb I Sabbah, Nitin Sawhney, Kaya Project, TJ Rehmi and Bombay Dub Orchestra.

station.name: PopTron!
station.description: Electropop and indie dance rock with sparkle and pop
station.longdesc: Indie dance rock. Less guitars, more synths. Catchy electro-pop songs from artists like Cut Copy, Datarock, MGMT and Hot Chip. You can't help but like it.

station.name: Underground 80s
station.description: Early 80s UK Synthpop and a bit of New Wave.
station.longdesc: Centered around UK Synthpop of the early 80s, you'll hear music from Human League, Depeche Mode, Thompson Twins, A Flock of Seagulls, New Order and Ultravox, as well as lesser known but critically acclaimed artists from the time such as New Musik, Comsat Angels, Lene Lovich, Fad Gadget and Robert Hazard.

station.name: Tag's Trip
station.description: Progressive house / trance. Tip top tunes

station.name: Sonic Universe
station.description: Transcending the world of jazz with eclectic, avant-garde takes on tradition.
station.longdesc: Call it Nu Jazz, call it Avant Garde, call it Euro-jazz. None of the labels do this music the justice of what it really is: a new direction in music that takes its direction from classic innovators in the past.

station.name: cliqhop idm
station.description: Blips'n'beeps backed mostly w/beats. Intelligent Dance Music
station.longdesc: Experimental techno, also known as Intelligent dance music (IDM). This is music composed digitally, creating sounds from bits rather than with bits and the instrument of choice of most IDM artists is a laptop computer. Typical artists include: Telefon Tel Aviv, Boards Of Canada, Autechre, Aphex Twin, Mu-ziq, Black Dog, Cex, Ulrich Schnauss, and Album Leaf.

station.name: Illinois Street Lounge
station.description: Classic bachelor pad, playful exotica and vintage music of tomorrow
station.longdesc: Bachelor-pad music for sipping cocktails and dressing swanky. Vintage music and exotica that was way ahead of its time.

station.name: Digitalis
station.description: Digitally affected analog rock to calm the agitated heart. Screengazing encouraged
station.longdesc: Digitally-affected analog rock; laptop rock; screengaze: these are some of the names that people give this new style of indie rock that's all about the shift of the recording studio into the laptop.

station.name: Mission Control
station.description: Celebrating NASA and Space Explorers everywhere.
station.longdesc: Celebrate Space! A mix of ambient and experimental music mixed with the historical sounds of the space program.

station.name: Doomed
station.description: Dark industrial/ambient music for tortured souls.
station.longdesc: A scary, haunting soundtrack.

station.name: Covers
station.description: Just Covers. Songs you know by artists you don't. We've got you covered
station.longdesc: An eclectic mix of music with one thing in common: All these songs were written and made famous by someone else first.

station.name: Black Rock FM
station.description: From the Playa to the world, for the 2010 Burning Man festival
station.longdesc: The prototype broadcast for 102.3 in Black Rock City, streaming year-round on SomaFM.

station.name: Boot Liquor
station.description: Americana Roots music for Cowhands, Cowpokes and Cowtippers
station.longdesc: Music that shows the ongoing hopelessness in your otherwise dreary life. Americana roots music (or what they used to call Country Western) that's both musically and lyrically unique.

station.name: SF 10-33
station.description: Ambient music mixed with the sounds of San Francisco public safety radio traffic

station.name: South By Soma
station.description: Music from bands who performed at SXSW, one of the biggest and best music festivals in the world. Explicit Content!
station.longdesc: An unofficial broadcast where you can check out the bands you'll hear at this year's South By festival. [explicit]

station.name: Folk Forward
station.description: Indie Folk, Alt-folk and the occasional folk classics.
station.longdesc: Contemporary indie folk music. A modern take on classic folk music, with occasional appearances by the classic masters.

station.name: BAGeL Radio
station.description: What alternative rock radio should sound like.
station.longdesc: Spanning four decades of great alternative, post-punk, indie rock and noise pop, you'll hear artists like Frightened Rabbit, The White Stripes, Metric, The National, Tune-Yards, Yeah Yeah Yeahs, The Thermals, The Smiths, Blur, Radiohead, Mission of Burma, Chameleons UK, Siouxsie & The Banshees, X, and just about every Slumberland Records band ever. And every Friday is 480 Minutes: Ted plays and discusses the latest and greatest music in real time. For eight hours. Seriously. From 9am-5pm Pacific.

station.name: Deep Space One
station.description: A soundtrack for deep space exploration, both inner and outer.
station.longdesc: Deep ambient electronic, experimental and space music with a tempo usually too slow for Space Station Soma, but too fast for Drone Zone.

station.name: DEF CON 21
station.description: DEF CON Radio: Music for hacking.
station.longdesc: SomaFM's special DEF CON 21 broadcast. DEF CON is one of the world's largest annual hacker conventions, held every year in Las Vegas, Nevada. This year, SomaFM is providing the music for the DEF CON Chill room where we'll be broadcasting from starting August 1st. And for the rest of July, SomaFM is broadcasting this special stream from San Francisco, hosted by the DJs who will be playing in Vegas.
